nodes.bodyText: I think this needs to go down below the upgrade_2_4_0 section.  See, for example, upgrade_221_notable and upgrade_111_notable sections, which appear below the upgrade_2_2_0 and upgrade_1_1_0 sections, respectively.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -19,6 +19,17 @@

nodes.bodyText: Ack.  That's where I had it initially, but I decided to put it up on top.  I'll revert and move it back to where it should be.  Thanks for the review!

nodes.bodyText: From what I can see in the file, the notable notes for the current release go before the ones for the previous release.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -82,6 +82,17 @@

Upgrading from 0.8.x, 0.9.x, 0.1 +
Notable changes in 2.4.1
+
    +
  • + ZooKeeper has been upgraded to 3.5.7, and a ZooKeeper upgrade from 3.4.X to 3.5.7 can fail if there are no snapshot files in the 3.4 data directory. + This usually happens in test upgrades where ZooKeeper 3.5.7 is trying to load an existing 3.4 data dir in which no snapshot file has been created. + For more details about the issue please refer to ZOOKEEPER-3056.

nodes.bodyText: This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters Suggested change A fix is given in ZOOKEEPER-3056, which is to set snapshot.trust.empty=true A fix is given in ZOOKEEPER-3056, which is to set the snapshot.trust.empty=true
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -82,6 +82,17 @@

Upgrading from 0.8.x, 0.9.x, 0.1 +
Notable changes in 2.4.1
+
    +
  • + ZooKeeper has been upgraded to 3.5.7, and a ZooKeeper upgrade from 3.4.X to 3.5.7 can fail if there are no snapshot files in the 3.4 data directory. + This usually happens in test upgrades where ZooKeeper 3.5.7 is trying to load an existing 3.4 data dir in which no snapshot file has been created. + For more details about the issue please refer to ZOOKEEPER-3056. + A fix is given in ZOOKEEPER-3056, which is to set snapshot.trust.empty=true
